data.title: Manlius New York Real Estate
data.meta_description: Homes for Sale in Manlius New York
data.text:
Fayetteville is a village with an intimate population of approximately 4,400 and has been whirling with economic activity since the first settlers arrived in 1792. In each of its snug, unique neighborhoods, parks provide play space. The Fayetteville Recreation Committee was formed in order to provide quality recreational activities for the village’s youths and adults. Community programs and events such as the Summer Playground at Fayetteville Elementary School, women’s lacrosse and field hockey campus, the annual Ski and Skate Sale, the annual Bike and Blade Sale, extended day music programs, bumper bowling tournaments, the Memorial Day Parade, Fayetteville First, and the Annual Tree Lighting Ceremony provide a warm and comfortable atmosphere for living in this area.

School: The Fayetteville-Manlius Central School District is a public school system, serving the majority of the Town of Manlius. Students residing in the Town of Manlius may also reside within the East Syracuse Minoa Central School District, or choose to attend Bishop Grimes Junior/Senior High, Christian Brothers Acadedy, Manlius Pebble Hill or other private schools in Metro Syracuse. Elementary schools: Fayetteville, Mott Road, Enders Road, Woodland, Fremont and Minoa. Middle schools: Wellwood Middle School (formerly Fayetteville High School), Eagle Hill, and Pine Grove. High school: Fayetteville-Manlius and East Syracuse Minoa.

Shopping & Dining: East Genesee Street is a main thoroughfare through Fayetteville which has numerous retail shops, eating establishments and a major outdoor shopping plaza (Fayetteville Towne Center). There are many chain restaurants in the area such as the Bonefish Grill, Carrabba's, J.P. Mulligans, Kirby's American Grill and Red Robin. Local Restaurants include Craftsman House, Hullars, King Davids, Kyoko's, Ling Ling Chinese, Papa Gallo Mexican Grill, Pardzee's, Pascale Wine Bar & Restaurant and Peco's.

Parks/Lakes/Recreation: There is a wide range of recreational activities available in the Town of Manlius. One can take pleasure in traveling the scenic Erie Canal with it's formidable hiking/biking trail. Limestone & Butternut creeks wind through the Town of Manlius, which is used by fisherman. Green Lakes State Park is actually part of a primeval forest with two small lakes Green, Round) that have a beautiful blue/green color where you can enjoy fishing, non motorized boating, hiking, picnicking and golfing. Green Lake is on of the most studied lakes in the world since it's layers of water do no mix together. This area is also a golfers paradise, since there are eight golf courses available to play (Calvary Club, The Links at Erie Village, Green Lakes, Lyndon, Old Oak, Onondaga Golf & Country Club, Pools Brook and Woodcrest).

Popular Neighborhoods in Manlius and Fayetteville New York:

There are many which include Academy Hill, Arbutus, Berkshire, Briar Brook, Brookside, Canterbury Woods, Cascade Estates, Eagle View, Fremont Hills, Fremont Meadows, Glen Eagle, Homewood, Huntleigh Park, Mallard's Landing, Minoa Farms, Pompey Pines, Ridgeview, Spruce Ridge, The Preserve and Quail Hollow.

New Home Construction in Manlius NY: This years Parade of Homes featuring new homes constructed by various builders was held in Mallard's Landing. Search all new construction homes in Manlius

How is the market in Manlius?: It is a buyers market in Manlius. The average sales price is $257,000 and the average time it takes to sell a house when priced correctly is 83 days.

How is the housing market in Fayetteville?:

The average sales price is $261,000 and the average time it takes to sell a house when priced correctly is 84 days.

See Current Market Data in Fayetteville Now!

How is the market in East Syracuse?: The average sales price is $127,000 and the average time it takes to sell a house when priced correctly is 46 days. The most buyer activity was in the $60,000 to $99,999 and the $100,000 to $139,000 price ranges, both at 32%.
